gameManager Class Reference

our main glwindow widget for NGL applications all drawing elements are put in this file. it is the game's main class and create the game world with all its haracters. it checks for collisions between the falling characters and the basket More...

#include <gameManager.h>

Detailed Description

our main glwindow widget for NGL applications all drawing elements are put in this file. it is the game's main class and create the game world with all its haracters. it checks for collisions between the falling characters and the basket

Definition at line 62 of file gameManager.h.

method to check the collision between basket and falling characters

_pos1 basket's position
_rad1 basket's radius

_rad2 falling character's radius

00334 {
00335     ngl::Vec3 relPos;
00336 
00337     //distance between basket and falling char
00338     GLfloat dist;
00339     GLfloat minDist;
00340     GLfloat len;
00341 
00342     relPos = _pos1 - _pos2;
00343     len = relPos.length();
00344     dist = len*len;
00345     minDist = _rad1 + _rad2;
00346 
00347     //check if there is a catch
00348     if(dist<= (minDist * minDist))
00349     {   return true;    }
00350     else
00351     {   return false;   }

void gameManager::initializeGL (  )  [protected]

The following methods must be implimented in the sub class this is called when the window is created.

This virtual function is called once before the first call to paintGL() or resizeGL(), and then once whenever the widget has been assigned a new QGLContext. This function should set up any required OpenGL context rendering flags, defining display lists, etc.

00095     // layout attribute 0 is the vertex data (x,y,z)
00096     shader->bindAttribute("Phong",0,"inVert");
00097     // attribute 1 is the UV data u,v (if present)
00098     shader->bindAttribute("Phong",1,"inUV");
00099     // attribute 2 are the normals x,y,z
00100     shader->bindAttribute("Phong",2,"inNormal");
00101     // now we have associated this data we can link the shader

00431 {
00432     // note the method buttons() is the button state when event was called
00433     // this is different from button() which is used to check which button was
00434     // pressed when the mousePress/Release event is generated
00435     if(m_rotate && _event->buttons() == Qt::LeftButton)
00436     {
00437       int diffx=_event->x()-m_origX;
00438       int diffy=_event->y()-m_origY;
00439       //m_spinXFace += (float) 0.5f * diffy;
00440       m_spinXFace += (float) 0.5f * diffy;
00441       m_spinYFace += (float) 0.5f * diffx;
00442       clampmouse (m_spinXFace, 5, 25);
00443       m_origX = _event->x();
00444       m_origY = _event->y();
00445       updateGL();
00446     }
00447     // right mouse translate code
00448     else if(m_translate && _event->buttons() == Qt::RightButton)
00449     {
00450       int diffX = (int)(_event->x() - m_origXPos);
00451       int diffY = (int)(_event->y() - m_origYPos);
00452       m_origXPos=_event->x();
00453       m_origYPos=_event->y();
00454       m_modelPos.m_x += INCREMENT * diffX;
00455       m_modelPos.m_y -= INCREMENT * diffY;
00456       updateGL();
00457     }
00458 }

void gameManager::moveBasket_gl (  ) 

method to move the basket with every key press updates the basket position with respect to arrow keys in x and z axis calls the move funtion of basket class to update basket position

Definition at line 273 of file gameManager.cpp.

References g_BasketUpdate, m_Basket, m_keysPressed, basket::moveBasket(), and basket::rotateBasket().

00274 {
00275     // first we reset the movement values
00276     float xDirection=0.0;
00277     //float yDirection=0.0;
00278     float zDirection=0.0;
00279 
00280     float rotation=0.0;
00281     foreach(Qt::Key key, m_keysPressed)
00282     {
00283         switch (key)
00284         {
00285             case Qt::Key_Left :  { xDirection =  g_BasketUpdate /*+ m_velo*/; break;}
00286             case Qt::Key_Right : { xDirection = -g_BasketUpdate /*+ m_velo*/; break;}
00287             case Qt::Key_Up :    { zDirection =  g_BasketUpdate; break;}
00288             case Qt::Key_Down :  { zDirection = -g_BasketUpdate; break;}
00289             case Qt::Key_R :     { rotation=1.0; break;}
00290             default : break;
00291         }
00292     }
00293     m_Basket->moveBasket(xDirection,zDirection);
00294     // if the set is non zero size we can update the basket movement
00295     // then tell openGL to re-draw
00296     if(m_keysPressed.size() !=0)
00297     {
00298         m_Basket->moveBasket(xDirection,zDirection);
00299         m_Basket->rotateBasket(rotation);
00300     }
00301 }

void gameManager::processKeyDown ( QKeyEvent *  _event  ) 

processKeyDown passed from the main window class

this method is called from the MainWindow class and passed the key event from that, if we didn't need to process the events in main window we could just overload this as the keyPressEvent and only process here.

Parameters:
*_event a pointer to the QKeyEvent passed from main window class

void gameManager::resizeGL ( const int  _w,
const int  _h 
) [protected]

this is called whenever the window is re-sized

This virtual function is called whenever the widget has been resized. The new size is passed in width and height.
